intro: Psychotria reevesii var. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. The plant contains various alkaloids, which have been of interest in botanical and pharmacological research.
